histogram.obsolete: Deprecated Sep 2023. See the new metrics Ash.LacrosMigrationStatus2 for data collected for M119 and after.
histogram.summary: Migration status from Ash to Lacros. It shows whether the user has migrated from Ash to Lacros and if they did with which migration mode.

histogram.name: Ash.LacrosMigrationStatus2
histogram.summary:
Migration status from Ash to Lacros. It shows whether the user has migrated from Ash to Lacros and if they did with which migration mode.
The same as "Ash.LacrosMigrationStatus" but further splits 'Uncompleted' into 'Uncompleted' and 'MaxAttemptReached'. Uncompleted means the user hasn't completed migration but has not reached its retry limit, meaning the migration will be attempted at the next chance. Meanwhile MaxAttemptReached means it failed more than the number of times allowed and won't be attempted again.

histogram.name: Ash.Login.ArcUiAvailableAfterLogin.Duration
histogram.summary: Time between primary user logged in (i.e. a successful cryptohome mount) and ARC boot completion..

histogram.name: Ash.Login.Lock.AuthMethod.Switched
histogram.summary: The count of auth method switching actions on ChromeOS lock screen.

histogram.name: Ash.Login.Lock.AuthMethod.Used.ClamShellMode
histogram.summary: The usage of different auth methods (PIN / Password / Smartlock / Fingerprint / Challenge response) on Chromebooks in clamshell mode and on other form-factors.

histogram.name: Ash.Login.Lock.AuthMethod.Used.TabletMode
histogram.summary: The usage of different auth methods (PIN / Password / Smartlock / Fingerprint / Challenge response) on Chromebooks in tablet mode.

histogram.name: Ash.Login.Lock.NbPasswordAttempts.UntilFailure
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in M111 and replaced with "Ash.OSAuth.Login/Lock.NbPasswordAttempts.UntilFailure".
histogram.summary: The number of incorrect passwords entered in Chrome OS login/lock screen until the user gives up (user signs out the current session or shuts down the device).

histogram.name: Ash.Login.Lock.NbPasswordAttempts.UntilSuccess
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in M111 and replaced with "Ash.OSAuth.Login/Lock.NbPasswordAttempts.UntilSuccess".
histogram.summary: The number of incorrect passwords entered in Chrome OS login/lock screen until a successful attempt.

histogram.name: Ash.Login.Lock.UserClicks
histogram.summary: The numbers of times that users click on the shelf buttons, trays and lock screen note on the ChromeOS lock screen.

histogram.name: Ash.Login.Login.AuthMethod.Switched
histogram.summary: The count of auth method switching actions on ChromeOS login screen.

histogram.name: Ash.Login.Login.AuthMethod.Used.ClamShellMode
histogram.summary: The usage of different auth methods (PIN / Password / Smartlock / Fingerprint / Challenge response) on Chromebooks in clamshell mode and on other form-factors.

histogram.name: Ash.Login.Login.AuthMethod.Used.TabletMode
histogram.summary: The usage of different auth methods (PIN / Password / Smartlock / Fingerprint / Challenge response) on Chromebooks in tablet mode.

histogram.name: Ash.Login.Login.MigrationBanner
histogram.summary: Whether the cryptohome migration banner was shown on the Chrome OS login screen.

histogram.name: Ash.Login.Login.UserClicks
histogram.summary: The numbers of times that users click on the shelf buttons and trays on the ChromeOS login screen.

histogram.name: Ash.Login.OOBE.UserClicks
histogram.summary: What shelf buttons or trays are clicked in the OOBE.

histogram.name: Ash.Login.PinAutosubmit.Backfill
histogram.summary: The result of the PIN auto submit 'Backfill' operation. Users updating to M86 with an existing PIN will have their preference regarding auto submit 'backfilled' to either enabled or disabled.

histogram.name: Ash.Login.ShowGaiaSignin.PermanentlyUntrusted
histogram.summary: Records instances of a "PERMANENTLY_UNTRUSTED" result during the check for trusted values before showing gaia signin. This is a fatal result which will result in signin not being shown.

histogram.name: Ash.Login.ShowGaiaSignin.WaitTime
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time spent waiting for trusted values before showing gaia signin. Waiting for trusted values ensures that the device owner id is present before showing the signin, which is necessary for checking signin permissions for child users. This check may introduce a delay for all users. This metric allows monitoring that delay.

histogram.name: Ash.Login.TimeUntilGoodADF
histogram.summary:
Time between user logged in (i.e. a successful cryptohome mount) and when good ADF (<= 20%) is observed for more than 5 seconds.
This histogram only records metrics on machines with high-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Ash.Login.TotalFirstSessionDuration
histogram.summary: Total user first session time between when the user was added to the device and session exit or device shutdown. Reported for primary users only.

histogram.name: Ash.Login.TotalSessionDuration
histogram.summary: Total user session time between sign-in and session exit or device shutdown. Reported for primary users only. First sessions are excluded and reported in a separate histogram: Ash.Login.TotalFirstSessionDuration.

histogram.name: Ash.LoginAnimation.Duration
histogram.summary: The duration of how long it took to finish all animations applied during the login process, from the time the first animation is added, to the time the last animation is finished.

histogram.name: Ash.LoginAnimation.Duration2.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: The duration of how long it took to finish all animations applied during the login process, from the time the first animation is added, to the time the last animation is finished. This metric is capped at 30 seconds, while above "Ash.LoginAnimation.Duration" capped at 5 seconds.

histogram.name: Ash.LoginAnimation.Jank
histogram.summary: Jank metrics of all animations applied during the login process. This represents how often the frame update rate changed during animation.

histogram.name: Ash.LoginAnimation.Smoothness
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of all animations applied during the login process. 100% represents the ideal smoothness for 60 frames per second.

histogram.name: Ash.LoginSessionRestore.AllBrowserWindowsCreated
histogram.summary: Time between primary user logged in (i.e. a successful cryptohome mount) and creation of all expected restored browser windows.

histogram.name: Ash.LoginSessionRestore.AllBrowserWindowsPresented
histogram.summary: The duration of how long it took for all pixels of expected restored windows to be rendered after primary user logged in (i.e. a successful cryptohome mount).

histogram.name: Ash.LoginSessionRestore.AllBrowserWindowsShown
histogram.summary: Time between primary user logged in (i.e. a successful cryptohome mount) and the full manifestation of all expected restored browser windows.

histogram.name: Ash.LoginSessionRestore.AllShelfIconsLoaded
histogram.summary: Time between primary user logged in (i.e. a successful cryptohome mount) and the complete loading of all pinned button icons for restored windows.

histogram.name: Ash.LoginSessionRestore.ShelfLoginAnimationEnd
histogram.summary: The duration of how long it took to load all the shelf icons of restored windows after primary user logged in (i.e. a successful cryptohome mount).

histogram.name: Ash.Media.CameraPrivacySwitch.Event
histogram.summary: Reports events related to camera privacy switch state. The camera privacy switch is a hardware toggle supported by some Chrome OS devices that disables the built in camera video feed. The histogram is reported (1) when a camera privacy switch state change is detected (which generally causes a system toast to get shown), and (2) when a notification informing the user that the camera privacy switch is on (the notification is shown if the user tries to use their camera with the privacy switch tuned on). The camera privacy switch state is only recorded if the state change is a result of a user action - it will not be recorded for state changes that are a result of camera privacy switch state initialization.

histogram.name: Ash.Media.CameraPrivacySwitch.TimeFromNotificationToOff
histogram.summary: Time from showing a notification informing the user about the camera privacy switch to the user turning the privacy switch off. The camera privacy switch is a hardware switch supported by some Chrome OS devices that cuts the video camera feed off. The Chrome OS UI shows a notification if the user tries to use the camera with the privacy switch on. The intention is to track the time it takes for the user to flip the privacy switch after they're notified the camera is disabled. The histogram is recorded if the user toggles the camera privacy switch after seeing the notification about the privacy switch being on (if the switch is toggled more than once after the notification gets shown, only the first toggle action will be reported). The time is reported in seconds with 5 second granularity.

histogram.name: Ash.MessageCenter.Scroll.PresentationTime
histogram.summary: Presentation time while scrolling through the list of notifications in Notification Center. Emitted when Notification Center is scrolled.

histogram.name: Ash.MessageCenter.Scroll.PresentationTime.MaxLatency
histogram.summary: Presentation time while scrolling through the list of notifications in Notification Center. Emitted when Notification Center is scrolled.

histogram.name: Ash.MojoServiceManager.BootstrapRetryTimes
histogram.summary: The retry times when try to bootstrap to mojo service manager.

histogram.name: Ash.MojoServiceManager.IsConnectionLost
histogram.summary: Whether the connection to mojo service manager is lost before during ash running.

histogram.name: Ash.MultiDisplay.WindowsMovedAfterRemap.DisplayRotated
histogram.summary: After a display rotation, the existing app windows will get remapped. A one minute timer then runs. If any of the app windows are moved or resized by the user, then this histogram records true. If the timer ends without an app window being moved or resized, then this histogram records false. Used to determine if the user is satisfied with the window manager auto remap.

histogram.name: Ash.MultiDisplay.WindowsMovedAfterRemap.DisplayWorkAreaChanged
histogram.summary: After a display work area change, the existing app windows will get remapped. A one minute timer then runs. If any of the app windows are moved or resized by the user, then this histogram records true. If the timer ends without an app window being moved or resized, then this histogram records false. Used to determine if the user is satisfied with the window manager auto remap.

histogram.name: Ash.NavigationWidget.AnimationSmoothness{HotseatTransitionType}
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of animations of the navigation widget's elements, which are the widget itself and its child views. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. 50% represents only 30 frames per second is achieved during the animations. Recorded every time an animation is triggered in the Navigation Widget. We record this metric for each element separately. {HotseatTransitionType}

histogram.name: Ash.NavigationWidget.{NavigationWidgetElement}AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of animations of the navigation widget's elements, which are the widget itself and its child views. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. 50% represents only 30 frames per second is achieved during the animations. Recorded every time an animation is triggered in the Navigation Widget. We record this metric for each element separately. {NavigationWidgetElement}

histogram.name: Ash.NightLight.AutoNightLightNotificationShown
histogram.summary: Emitted when the Auto Night Light notification is shown.

histogram.name: Ash.NightLight.AutoNightLightNotificationState
histogram.summary: Emitted when the user interacts with the Auto Night Light notification to report the state of the notification as a result of this interaction.

histogram.name: Ash.NightLight.DisplayCrtcCtmSupport
histogram.summary: The type of CRTC color transorm matrix support for the currently connected displays. Emitted when cursor compositing status is refreshed, but only when Night Light is on. The cursor compositing status is refreshed whenever there is a change in Night Light status or color temperature.

histogram.name: Ash.NightLight.ScheduleType
histogram.summary: The selected Night Light schedule type. Emitted when the user changes the Night Light schedule type from the Display System Settings.

histogram.name: Ash.NightLight.Temperature
histogram.summary: The ranges in which the selected values of the Night Light color temperature reside. Emitted when the user drags the Night Light color temperature slider to change its value from the Display System Settings.

histogram.name: Ash.Notification.ClearAllStacked.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Animation smoothness of the "clear all" animation in the CrOS message center. This occurs when the clear all button is pressed with notifications that are not visible on screen. Measured via a throughtput tracker.

histogram.name: Ash.Notification.ClearAllVisible.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Animation smoothness of the "clear all" animation in the CrOS message center. This occurs when the clear all button is pressed and all notifications are visible. Measured via a throughtput tracker.

histogram.name: Ash.Notification.CountOfNotificationsInOneGroup
histogram.summary: The number of notification contained in one group. Emitted when a notification is added or removed from a group.

histogram.name: Ash.Notification.ExpandOrCollapse.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Animation smoothness of the "Expand or Collapse" animation in the CrOS message center. This occurs when the notification requests a size change due to being expanded or collapsed. Usually involves other layer animations which are named (get name from leandre@).

histogram.name: Ash.Notification.GroupNotification.SlideOut.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Animation smoothness of the slide out part of the animation when a grouped notification is removed. Emmitted when a grouped notification is removed by clicking on it's close button.

histogram.name: Ash.Notification.GroupNotificationAdded
histogram.summary: Record the types of group notification added to the system. The types are group parent and group child. Emitted when a group notification is created.

histogram.name: Ash.Notification.MoveDown.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Animation smoothness of the "move down" animation in the CrOS message center. This occurs when a notification is removed and notifications above the deleted one animate downwards to fill in the space. Measured via a throughtput tracker.

histogram.name: Ash.Notification.SwipeControl.FadeIn.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of the fade in animation of the settings button inside a swipe control notification view. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. Emitted when the fade in animation is completed.

histogram.name: Ash.NotificationPopup.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of animations of notification pop-up. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. Emitted when pop-up animations are completed, including pop-up fade-in, fade-out, move-up, move-down.

histogram.name: Ash.NotificationPopup.OnTopOfSurfacesPopupCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of popups that show up on top of a UI surface. Emitted when the UI surface is shown or changes height when popup notifications are visible, and when there's a new notification popup added when the UI surface is visible.

histogram.name: Ash.NotificationPopup.OnTopOfSurfacesType
histogram.summary: Records the type of UI surface that popup notifications are shown on top of. Emitted when the UI surface is shown or changes height when popup notifications are visible, and when there's a new notification popup added when the UI surface is visible.

histogram.name: Ash.NotificationView.ConvertSingleToGroup.{Animation}.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of the {Animation} in notification view when converting from single to group notification. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. Emitted when the animation is completed.

histogram.name: Ash.NotificationView.ExpandButton.BoundsChange.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of the bounds change animation of the expand button inside a notification view. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. Emitted when the animation is completed.

histogram.name: Ash.NotificationView.ExpandButton.ClickAction
histogram.summary: The count of actions that is performed after an expand button is clicked. The actions are expanding or collapsing individual or group notification. Emitted when an expand button is clicked.

histogram.name: Ash.NotificationView.ExpandButton.ConvertSingleToGroup.{Animation}.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of the {Animation} inside the expand button of the notification view when converting from single to group notification. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. Emitted when the animation is completed.

histogram.name: Ash.NotificationView.ImageContainerView.ScaleDown.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of the scale down animation of image container view inside a notification view. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. Emitted when the scale down animation is completed.

histogram.name: Ash.NotificationView.ImageDrag.EndState
histogram.summary: Records the notification drag end state when the notification image drag ends.

histogram.name: Ash.NotificationView.ImageDrag.Start
histogram.summary: Records the notification catalog name when the notification image drag starts.

histogram.name: Ash.NotificationView.NotificationAdded.Type
histogram.summary: Records the types of notification view added to the system. Emitted when each notification is added and the notification is visible.

histogram.name: Ash.NotificationView.{ChildView}.FadeIn.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of the fade in animation of {ChildView} inside a notification view. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. Emitted when the fade in animation is completed.

histogram.name: Ash.NotificationView.{ChildView}.FadeOut.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of the fade out animation of {ChildView} inside a notification view. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. Emitted when the fade out animation is completed.

histogram.name: Ash.NotificationView.{ChildView}.ScaleAndTranslate.AnimationSmoothness
Ash.NotifierFramework.Nudge.ShownCount
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of times a specific nudge is shown to users. This metric is recorded every time a nudge is shown.

histogram.name: Ash.NotifierFramework.Nudge.TimeToAction.{TimeRange}
histogram.summary: Tracks the time from when a specific educational nudge is shown to when it's interacted with. Starts measuring time when the nudge is shown and records the Nudge catalog name in one of the time buckets available if the user performs the nudge's suggested action.

histogram.name: Ash.NotifierFramework.Nudge.{FirstOrSecond}ButtonPressed
histogram.summary: Records the nudge catalog name when a user presses one of the nudge's buttons.

histogram.name: Ash.NotifierFramework.Toast.Dismissed.{TimeRange}
histogram.summary: Tracks the time a specific toast spends on screen before being dismissed by the user or system. Records the toast catalog name in one of the time buckets available when toast is dismissed either manually or by time out.

histogram.name: Ash.NotifierFramework.Toast.ShownCount
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of times a specific toast is shown to users. This metric is recorded every time a toast is shown.

histogram.name: Ash.NotifierFramework.Toast.TimeInQueue
histogram.summary: Records the time a toast spends in queue before it's shown on screen.

histogram.name: Ash.NotifierFramework.{UnpinnedOrPinned}SystemNotification.Added
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of times a specific system notification is added to the notification list. This metric is recorded every time the `OnNotificationAdded` event is triggered for a system notification.

histogram.name: Ash.NotifierFramework.{UnpinnedOrPinned}SystemNotification.Popup.Dismissed.{TimeRange}
histogram.summary: Tracks the time a specific system notification spends as a pop-up before being dismissed either by the user or system. Records the notification catalog name in one of the time buckets available when the pop-up is dismissed either manually or by time out.

histogram.name: Ash.NotifierFramework.{UnpinnedOrPinned}SystemNotification.Popup.ShownCount
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of times a specific system notification pop-up is shown to users.

histogram.name: Ash.NotifierFramework.{UnpinnedOrPinned}SystemNotification.Popup.UserJourneyTime
histogram.summary: Records the time a system notification spends as a pop-up before being dismissed either by the user or system. Starts measuring time whenever the pop-up is shown to the user, and records metric when the pop-up is dismissed either manually or by time out.

histogram.name: Ash.OSAuth.Login.ConfiguredAuthFactors.{AuthFactor}
histogram.summary: Whether the logged in user has {AuthFactor} auth factor configured. Recorded upon successful login.

histogram.name: Ash.OSAuth.{AuthenticationSurface}.NbPasswordAttempts.{AuthenticationOutcome}
histogram.summary: The number of incorrect passwords entered in Chrome OS {AuthenticationSurface} screen until the "{AuthenticationOutcome}" outcome. For previous data (grouped for login and lock screen together) see "Ash.Login.Lock.NbPasswordAttempts.*".

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.AnimationSmoothness.Close
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of animations when closing a window, recorded when the animation completes. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.AnimationSmoothness.Enter{OverviewAnimationMode}
Ash.Overview.AnimationSmoothness.Exit{OverviewAnimationMode}
Ash.Overview.ArrowKeyPresses
histogram.summary: The number of times the arrow keys are pressed in overview mode per session, i.e. between bringing up overview mode and ending it. This is only measured for the sessions that end by selecting a window with the enter key.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.EndAction
histogram.summary: Emitted when exiting overview mode. Recording the reasons for ending overview mode. E.g, pressing the overview button at status area.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.Enter.PresentationTime
histogram.summary: Records the presentation time, which is the time in milliseconds it takes from when the overview enter event was received and successfully processed to when the next frame is shown to the user.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.Exit.PresentationTime
histogram.summary: Records the presentation time, which is the time in milliseconds it takes from when the overview exit event was received and successfully processed to when the next frame is shown to the user.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.Items
histogram.summary: The number of items (single windows or groups of windows such as panels) in the overview mode, present at the start of each session.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.KeyPressesOverItemsRatio
histogram.summary: The ratio between the arrow key presses and the number of overview items, expressed as a percentage for a single session. Recorded when an overview session is exited after selecting a highlighted overview item.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.OverviewClosedItems
histogram.summary: The number of items closed from the window overview for a single session. Recorded when exiting an overview session.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.Scroll.PresentationTime.MaxLatency.TabletMode
histogram.summary: Maximum latency of the presentation time for scrolling the overview grid in overview mode for a scrolling session.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.Scroll.PresentationTime.TabletMode
histogram.summary: Presentation time for scrolling the overview grid in overview mode. Each time the grid is updated by a scroll, the time it takes to update the new visuals onto the screen is updated.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.SelectionDepth
histogram.summary: When a window is selected in overview mode, records that window's position in the global MRU ordering. 1 represents the most-recently used window, 2 represents the next most-recently used window, and so on.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.StartAction
histogram.summary: Emitted when entering overview mode. Recording the reasons for starting overview mode. E.g, pressing the overview button at status area.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.TimeBetweenActiveWindowChanges
histogram.summary: The amount of time between endings of overview mode sessions which were caused by the user selecting a window which was not previously active. Only recorded on the second and later times after startup that the user selected a window which was not previously active.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.TimeBetweenUse
histogram.summary: The amount of time between uses of overview mode, recorded when overview mode is entered. Only recorded on the second and later times after startup that the user entered overview mode.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.TimeInOverview
histogram.summary: The amount of time spent in overview mode. Overview mode is engaged by pressing the overview accelerator, overview button tray or swiping up from the shelf in tablet mode. The time is measured from the moment the windows begin animating to a thumbnail size preview to when a window is selected or selection is canceled. Recorded when an overview session is exited, before the exit animation starts.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.WindowDrag.PresentationTime
histogram.summary: Presentation time for dragging a window in overview mode.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.WindowDrag.PresentationTime.MaxLatency
histogram.summary: Maximum latency of the presentation time for dragging a window in overview mode.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.WindowDrag.Workflow
histogram.summary: Recorded when a drag from overview (not from the top or shelf) is completed, and when an overview item is closed by vertically swiping or flinging (even if you fling without dragging).

histogram.name: Ash.Peripheral.ConnectivityResults
histogram.summary:
The connectivity results of when the user plugs in a Thunderbolt/USB4 peripheral to their Chrome OS device. This is recorded for only devices that support Thunderbolt/USB4 connectivity. Gets recorded every time a Thunderbolt/USB4 peripheral is plugged in. This histogram is based off of the obsolete Ash.PciePeripheral.ConnectivityResults histogram and also includes invalid cable detection from the Chrome OS type-c daemon.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2022-12-31 to 2023-08-21; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Ash.PersistentWindow.NumOfWindowsRestoredOnDisplayAdded
histogram.summary: The number of windows restored in multi-display scenario, such as due to disconnecting and reconnecting display, enabling and disabling mirror mode, entering and leaving dock mode. Zero is not recorded.

histogram.name: Ash.PersistentWindow.NumOfWindowsRestoredOnScreenRotation
histogram.summary: Emits the number of windows bounds restored when rotating the screen back to the previous screen orientation. Zero is not recorded.

histogram.name: Ash.Personalization.Ambient.GooglePhotosPreviewsLoadTime
histogram.summary: Emitted when a request to load ambient mode google photos albums preview images completes, but only upon first page load. This roughly corresponds to user perceived time it takes to load the ambient preview section of Personalization App. Does not emit if a user opens Personalization App onto a page that does not load google photos albums previews. Does not emit unless the user already has ambient mode enabled and Google Photos selected as the source upon first opening Personalization App.

histogram.name: Ash.Personalization.AmbientMode.AnimationTheme2
histogram.summary: Emitted when a user selects an animation theme in screensaver subpage or when screensaver is first enabled. In the latter case, the theme is recorded here even without the user explicitly selecting it in the screensaver subpage. The theme in this case will either be the default chosen by the system, or the theme that the user had selected when they last disabled screensaver.

histogram.name: Ash.Personalization.AmbientMode.OptIn
histogram.summary: Emitted when a user presses the `Turn on` button on ambient preview to enable screen saver.

histogram.name: Ash.Personalization.AmbientMode.ScreenSaverDuration
histogram.summary: Emitted when a user selects a new screen saver duration option.

histogram.name: Ash.Personalization.AmbientMode.Video2
histogram.summary: Emitted when a user selects the video theme, selects a new video in the screensaver subpage, or enables screensaver with a video theme automatically active. The latter can happen if a video theme is the default on that particular device model, or if the user had selected a video theme in the past when they last disabled screensaver.

histogram.name: Ash.Personalization.App.Duration
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time a user spends in the Personalization App on each visit.

histogram.name: Ash.Personalization.DynamicColor.ColorScheme.Settled
histogram.summary: Records the color scheme that the user has settled on. Emitted once for every UMA upload.

histogram.name: Ash.Personalization.DynamicColor.ColorSchemeButton
histogram.summary: Emitted when a user clicks a button to choose a color scheme for dynamic color in personalization hub.

histogram.name: Ash.Personalization.DynamicColor.StaticColor.Settled
histogram.summary: Records the static color that the user has settled on. Emitted once for every UMA upload.

histogram.name: Ash.Personalization.DynamicColor.StaticColorButton
histogram.summary: Emitted when a user clicks a static color button for dynamic color in personalization hub.

histogram.name: Ash.Personalization.DynamicColor.ToggleButton
histogram.summary: Emitted when a user clicks the toggle button to enable or disable dynamic color in personalization hub.

histogram.name: Ash.Personalization.EntryPoint
histogram.summary: Records which entry point is used to access Personalization Hub. Emitted every time Personalization hub is accessed.

histogram.name: Ash.Personalization.KeyboardBacklight.Color
histogram.summary: Emitted when a user selects a keyboard backlight color in personalization hub.

histogram.name: Ash.Personalization.KeyboardBacklight.Color.Settled
histogram.summary: Records the keyboard backlight color that the user has settled on. Emitted once for every UMA upload.

histogram.name: Ash.Personalization.KeyboardBacklight.DisplayType.Settled
histogram.summary: Records the display type of keyboard backlight color that the user has settled on. Emitted once for every UMA upload.

histogram.name: Ash.Personalization.KeyboardBacklight.OpenZoneCustomization
histogram.summary: Emitted every time the user selects 'Customize' button to open zone customization dialog to view or set zone colors, even when no zone color changed.

histogram.name: Ash.Personalization.KeyboardBacklight.WallpaperColor.Valid
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated July 2023. See the new metrics Ash.Personalization.KeyboardBacklight.WallpaperColor.Valid2.
histogram.summary: Emitted when the keyboard backlight is updated to a new wallpaper extracted color. Non transparent colors are considered valid.

histogram.name: Ash.Personalization.KeyboardBacklight.WallpaperColor.Valid2
histogram.summary: Emitted when the wallpaper extracted color is available and the keyboard backlight selection is updated to be wallpaper color. Only non transparent colors are considered valid.

histogram.name: Ash.Personalization.KeyboardBacklight.ZoneColors.Zone{ZoneIdx}.Settled
histogram.summary: Records the keyboard backlight color for zone {ZoneIdx} that the user has settled on. Emitted once for every UMA upload if the user currently uses customized zone colors for keyboard backlight.

histogram.name: Ash.Personalization.Path
histogram.summary: Emitted when a user navigates to a valid path in personalization hub.

histogram.name: Ash.Personalization.Theme.ColorMode
histogram.summary: Emitted when a user selects a theme button in personalization hub.

histogram.name: Ash.PhantomWindowController.Show.PresentationTime
histogram.summary: Records the presentation time, which is the time in milliseconds it takes from when show phantom window was received and successfully processed to when the next frame is shown to the user. The phantom window is shown to give users an indication of the window bounds of the next state. For example, when dragging a window to the left side of the display, the phantom window will take up roughly the left half of the work area to indicate the bounds of the window, if the drag is completed.

histogram.name: Ash.Pip.AndroidPipUseTime
histogram.summary:
How long Android PIP was used for, upon ending the session.
This metric was expired between April 2022 and July 2023 and may be missing data.

histogram.name: Ash.Pip.Events
histogram.summary:
Various individiual Picture-in-picture related events. See AshPipEvents.
This metric was expired between April 2022 and July 2023 and may be missing data.

histogram.name: Ash.PostLoginGlanceables.HypotheticalFetchEvent.{Delay}
histogram.summary:
Recorded any time a code path is triggered which would require post login glanceable data to be fetched and/or displayed to the user. This histogram is meant to be used for estimating how often we would typically want to fetch and then show this data.
This histogram is split by different variants. The "No Delay" variant is the raw query rate, while the 15/30 second delay variants are to experiment with throttling, where the metric will not be recorded more than once within any single 15/30 second time span.

histogram.name: Ash.PowerSoundsController.PluggedInBatteryLevel
histogram.summary: Record the battery level when a charger is connected and the battery status is from discharging to charging.

histogram.name: Ash.PowerSoundsController.UnpluggedBatteryLevel
histogram.summary: Record the battery level when a charger is unplugged and the battery status is from charging to discharging.

histogram.name: Ash.PrivacyIndicators.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Animation smoothness of the privacy indicators view animation. This occurs when an app is accessing camera/microphone or screen sharing and a green indicator appears on the status area button. Measured via a throughtput tracker.

histogram.name: Ash.PrivacyIndicators.AppAccessUpdate.Type
histogram.summary: Record the type of the app that change the status of camera/microphone access. Emitted when there is any change in the status of camera/microphone access.

histogram.name: Ash.PrivacyIndicators.IndicatorShowsDuration
histogram.summary: Record the duration of showing for privacy indicators. Emitted when the privacy indicators view is hidden after a show in the status tray.

histogram.name: Ash.PrivacyIndicators.LaunchSettings
histogram.summary: Record the type of the app that associate with the privacy indicators notification whose settings button is clicked. Emitted when the user click on the settings button of that notification.

histogram.name: Ash.PrivacyIndicators.NumberOfAppsAccessingCamera
histogram.summary: Record the number of apps that access the camera at the same time. Emitted when there are one or more apps accessing the camera.

histogram.name: Ash.PrivacyIndicators.NumberOfAppsAccessingMicrophone
histogram.summary: Record the number of apps that access the microphone at the same time. Emitted when there are one or more apps accessing the microphone.

histogram.name: Ash.PrivacyIndicators.NumberOfRepeatedShows
histogram.summary: Record the number of times that the privacy indicator repeatedly shows per 100ms. Emitted when the sequence of consecutive shows in the privacy indicator has finished.

histogram.name: Ash.PrivacyIndicators.NumberOfShowsPerSession
histogram.summary: Record the number of times that the tray indicator shows in the tray per session. Emitted when there is a change in user session.

histogram.name: Ash.PrivacyIndicators.ShowType
histogram.summary: Record the type of privacy indicators shown. Emitted when the privacy indicators view is shown in the status tray.

histogram.name: Ash.PrivacyIndicators.Source
histogram.summary: Record the source that use privacy indicators. Emitted when there's a client calling into the function that updates the privacy indicators.

histogram.name: Ash.PrivacyIndicators.{Icon}.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Animation smoothness of the privacy indicators {Icon} fade in animation. This occurs when an app is accessing camera/microphone or screen sharing and a green indicator appears on the status area button.

histogram.name: Ash.Projector.CreationFlow.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Tracks how the user progresses through the creation flow in {TabletOrClamshell}, recorded each time the user starts or ends a screencast recording.

histogram.name: Ash.Projector.CreationFlowError.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Tracks the most common errors during the screencast recording creation process in {TabletOrClamshell}, recorded each time an error occurs.

histogram.name: Ash.Projector.MarkerColor.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever the user chooses a marker color on the Projector toolbar in {TabletOrClamshell}. This metric records when the user changes the color or when the annotator toggles on, to record the saved last used color.

histogram.name: Ash.Projector.OnDeviceToServerSpeechRecognitionFallbackReason
histogram.summary: Records the fallback reason of using server based speech recognition instead of on device speech recogniton. This metric is recorded on server based speech recognition in projector session.

histogram.name: Ash.Projector.PendingScreencastBatchIOTaskDuration
histogram.summary: Tracks the processing time of batch pending screencast files validation on IO thread. Recorded each time when IO task finishes.

histogram.name: Ash.Projector.PendingScreencastChangeInterval
histogram.summary: Tracks the interval between UI updates during screencast uploading. Recorded at each pending screencast's UI change except for the first one of current uploading phase.

histogram.name: Ash.Projector.PolicyChangeHandlingError
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in M116. No longer needed since no error reported and converted to CHECK.
histogram.summary: Records the nullptr error that potentially caused a crash when handling policy changes.

histogram.name: Ash.Projector.SpeechRecognitionEndState.{Location}
histogram.summary: For a recognition session happening at {Location}, this histogram records the recognition status at the end of the session.

histogram.name: Ash.Projector.Toolbar.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever the user opens, closes, or presses a button the Projector toolbar in {TabletOrClamshell}.

histogram.name: Ash.Projector.TranscriptsCount.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of transcripts generated during a recording in {TabletOrClamshell}, recorded each time the metadata file saved successfully after a recording ends.

histogram.name: Ash.QuickSettings.Button.Activated
histogram.summary: Recorded when any button in the quick settings view is activated.

histogram.name: Ash.QuickSettings.FeaturePod.{FeaturePodBehavior}
histogram.summary: Recorded when an action is done on any FeaturePod in the quick settings view. {FeaturePodBehavior} can be a toggle to enable the feature, toggle to disable this feature, going to the feature's detailed page, or making the button visible.

variant.name: DiveIn
variant.summary: Go to the feature's detailed page

histogram.name: Ash.QuickSettings.PageCountOnClose
histogram.summary: The number of quick settings pagination pages in the new quick settings UI. This metric is recorded each time the quick settings are closed. Note that this will also get recorded when the user opens and then closes the status area calendar (even if they never viewed the quick settings), until b/285280977 is fixed.

histogram.name: Ash.QuickSettings.Slider.{SliderBehavior}
histogram.summary: Recorded when an action is done on any slider in the quick settings view or in the slider bubble. {SliderBehavior} can be changing the value or toggling to enable the feature.

histogram.name: Ash.QuickSettings.UserJourneyTime
histogram.summary: Records time user spent in Quick Settings opened through the Status Area button. Starts measuring time whenever the QS bubble is opened, and records metric when the QS bubble is closed.

histogram.name: Ash.QuickSettings.{DeviceMode}.FeaturePodCountOnOpen
histogram.summary: The number of feature pods (e.g. WiFi, Bluetooth, IME, Accessibility, etc.) in the system tray quick settings when it is opened, including pods that overflow to other pages. This metric is logged by 2 different types of {DeviceMode}: "Clamshell" and "Tablet". This metric gets recorded for both the new quick settings view and the old unified system view, see "Ash.UnifiedSystemView.{DeviceMode}.FeaturePodCountOnOpen" which is the metric for the old view.

histogram.name: Ash.Report.IsPsm{PsmUseCase}OprfResponseBodySet
histogram.summary: Record success if the PSM OPRF response for {PsmUseCase} contains a value. This network request is called after browser start if the last ping timestamp of the Chromebook is not known. ChromeOS only.

histogram.name: Ash.Report.IsPsm{PsmUseCase}OprfResponseParsedCorrectly
histogram.summary: Record success if the PSM OPRF response for {PsmUseCase} is able to be parsed correctly. This network request is called after browser start if the last ping timestamp of the Chromebook is not known. ChromeOS only.

histogram.name: Ash.Report.PreservedFileReadAndParsed
histogram.summary: Record whether the preserved file read and successfully parsed all known last active UTC dates. ChromeOS only.

histogram.name: Ash.Report.PreservedFileWritten
histogram.summary: Record whether the preserved file was written successfully over DBus for last active UTC dates. This histogram is recorded after browser start up, when the device attempts to read the preserved file storing the last known UTC dates. ChromeOS only.

histogram.name: Ash.Report.PsmQueryMembershipResult
histogram.summary: Record whether the private set membership query response contains queried ID that is known or not known. This histogram is recorded after the check membership request is fulfilled by the Fresnel server. The response code indicates whether the queried ID is present in the privacy complaint PSM database. ChromeOS only.

histogram.name: Ash.Report.Psm{PsmUseCase}{PsmRequest}ResponseNetErrorCode
histogram.summary: Emit the NetError code associated with the {PsmUseCase} {PsmRequest} response. Network requests are called after the browser is instantiated and the device is connected to the internet. Enum for histogram will contain 0 - 899. Ranges are defined //net/base/net_error_list.h;l=14-23. ChromeOS only.

histogram.name: Ash.Report.{PsmUseCase}CheckMembershipCases
histogram.summary: Record the number of different failed/success cases for the {PsmUseCase} check membership process. ChromeOS only.

histogram.name: Ash.Rotation.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of animations when rotating screen. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. 50% represents only 30 frames per second is achieved during the animations. 0% should not happen. This metric is recorded exactly once when the user rotates the screen.

histogram.name: Ash.Search.DriveFileSuggestDataValidation.Status
histogram.summary: The outcome of drive file suggestion data validation. Recorded once per validation.

histogram.name: Ash.SearchModelUpdateTime.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Records the time interval between user-initiated search model updates after the user starts a search query. Used to record how quickly users update the search model in {TabletOrClamshell} after the first keystroke.

histogram.name: Ash.SearchResultUpdateAnimationShortened
histogram.summary: Records whether search result animation times were shorted for recent search result update animation preemptions. Recorded when productivity launcher search containers' results change while result containers are still animating.

histogram.name: Ash.ServerBasedSpeechRecognition.AudioLengthLeftWhenAudioCaptureEnd
histogram.summary: Records the length of remaining un-transcribed audio when the audio capture stops.

histogram.name: Ash.ServerBasedSpeechRecognition.EndOfRecognitionSignalLatency
histogram.summary: Records the time user needs to wait to get the final speech recognition result after audio capture stops.

histogram.name: Ash.ServerBasedSpeechRecognition.ErrorCode
histogram.summary: Records the network error or HTTP response code of server based speech recognition request when an an error occurred.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.Menu.NumItemsEnabledUponSelection
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of menu items that are enabled in a shelf item's secondary menu. This metric is only recorded when a menu item is selected.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.Menu.SelectedMenuItemIndex
histogram.summary: Tracks the index of the selected menu item in a shelf item's secondary menu. This metric is only recorded when a menu item is selected.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.NumberOfItems
histogram.summary: The number of icons in the shelf, not including the App Launcher icon. This metric is recorded every 30 minutes.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.NumberOfPinnedItems
histogram.summary: The number of pinned icons in the shelf, not including the App Launcher icon. This metric is recorded every 30 minutes.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.NumberOfUnpinnedItems
histogram.summary: The number of unpinned icons in the shelf. This metric is recorded every 30 minutes.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.Palette.Assistant.CircledPercentage
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in M111. No longer needed since metalayer was deprecated in M110.
histogram.summary: The percentage of the screen area circled by the Assistant pen. Recorded when the "closed shape" gesture is recognized.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.Palette.Assistant.DeprecateStylusFeaturesToastEvent
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in M111.
histogram.summary: Whether or not the user is shown the limitation toast notifying that the Assistant stylus features (i.e. what's on my screen) have been deprecated. Also considers whether or not the deprecation flag has been set. Recorded upon every stylus long press action.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.Palette.Assistant.GestureDuration
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in M111. No longer needed since metalayer was deprecated in M110.
histogram.summary: The duration of an Assistant pen gesture. Recorded at the end of every gesture.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.Palette.Assistant.GestureInterval
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in M111. No longer needed since metalayer was deprecated in M110.
histogram.summary: The interval between subsequent Assistant pen gestures within a session. Session is defined as the period while the Assistant tool is enabled. Recorded at the end of each gesture except for the first one in the session. The interval is computed excluding the gesture duration.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.Palette.Assistant.GesturesPerSession
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in M111. No longer needed since metalayer was deprecated in M110.
histogram.summary: The number of Assistant pen gestures per session. Session is defined as the period while the Assistant tool is enabled. Recorded at the end of the session.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.Palette.Assistant.GesturesPerSession.Recognized
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in M111. No longer needed since metalayer was deprecated in M110.
histogram.summary: The number of recognized Assistant pen gestures per session. Session is defined as the period while the Assistant tool is enabled. Recorded at the end of the session.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.Palette.Assistant.GestureType
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in M111. No longer needed since metalayer was deprecated in M110.
histogram.summary: The type of the Assistant pen gesture. Recorded at the end of each gesture.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.Palette.Assistant.HighlighterLength
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in M111. No longer needed since metalayer was deprecated in M110.
histogram.summary: The length of a recognized "horizontal stroke" Assistant pen gesture. Recorded at the and of the gesture.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.Palette.InAssistantMode
histogram.obsolete: Kept to view historical data.
histogram.summary: The amount of time spent in Palette Assistant mode. Recorded when the Assistant mode is exited.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.Palette.InLaserPointerMode
histogram.obsolete: Kept to view historical data.
histogram.summary: The amount of time spend in Palette Laser pointer mode. Recorded when the Laser pointer mode is exited.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.Palette.InMagnifyMode
histogram.obsolete: Kept to view historical data.
histogram.summary: The amount of time spend in Palette Magnify mode. Recorded when the Magnify mode is exited.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.Palette.ModeCancellation
histogram.obsolete: Kept to view historical data.
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of times a palette mode is explicitly cancelled or switched out of.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.ShowStackedHotseat
histogram.summary: Show stacked hotseat app bar above the shelf button panels/system tray when there is no enough space for the app bar.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.ShutdownConfirmationBubble.Action
histogram.summary: Track actions on the shutdown confirmation bubble, if it's opened, dismissed or which buttons are clicked.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.ShutdownConfirmationBubble.TimeToNextBoot.LoginShutdownToPowerUpDuration
histogram.summary: Emitted at device start-up if a shut-down was previously initiated from the shelf shutdown button. In other words this metric is only recorded if a shelf shutdown button was pressed and the device was powered up again soon after that.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.TimeBetweenWindowMinimizedAndActivatedActions
histogram.summary: Tracks the amount of time between a window being minimized by the shelf and subsequently activated. In other words this metric is only recorded if a shelf button pressed action causes a window to be minimized and the very next shelf button pressed action causes the same window to be activated.

histogram.name: Ash.ShelfAlignmentUsage
histogram.summary: The current state of the shelf (alignment) when the shelf launcher is used to launch an app/window/etc, this is used instead of log in to give data on users that do not lock/unlock or log in frequently.

histogram.name: Ash.ShelfIcon.AnimationSmoothness{ShelfIconAnimationType}
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of animations of the shelf icons. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. Recorded when shelf icon animations are completed, including icon move, icon fade-in and icon fade-out. {ShelfIconAnimationType}

histogram.name: Ash.ShortcutCustomization.AddAccelerator.{ActionName}
histogram.summary: Record which accelerator is added by the user for {ActionName}. This metric also includes accelerators added from editing an accelerator. A shortcut is encoded as an int where the high 16 bits represent all the modifiers used, and the 0-15 bits represent which key is used.

histogram.name: Ash.ShortcutCustomization.AddAcceleratorSubactions
histogram.summary: Tracks the subactions that can occur when the user attempts to add a custom accelerator.

histogram.name: Ash.ShortcutCustomization.CustomizationAction
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of times a shortcut customization action has taken place from the Key Shortcuts App.

histogram.name: Ash.ShortcutCustomization.CustomizationsBeforeResetAll
histogram.summary: Record the number of customizations before the user resets their shortcuts to default.

histogram.name: Ash.ShortcutCustomization.CustomizationsLoadedOnStartup
histogram.summary: Record the number of customized accelerator modifications on startup.

histogram.name: Ash.ShortcutCustomization.EditAcceleratorSubactions
histogram.summary: Tracks the subactions that can occur when the user attempts to edit an accelerator.

histogram.name: Ash.ShortcutCustomization.EditDialogCompletedActions
histogram.summary: Tracks the actions done in the accelerator edit dialog before it was closed. If an action has been done at least once it will count towards the appropriate enum. Enums are formatted such that they are ordered in a bitwise manner. 0000: no action, 0001: Add, 0010: Edit, 0100: Remove, 1000: Reset.

histogram.name: Ash.ShortcutCustomization.MainCategoryNavigation
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of times a user navigates to a main category in the side panel of the Key Shortcuts app.

histogram.name: Ash.ShortcutCustomization.ModifyType.{ActionName}
histogram.summary: Record what modification actions that were done for {ActionName}.

histogram.name: Ash.ShortcutCustomization.RemoveDefaultAccelerator.{ActionName}
histogram.summary: Record which default accelerator is removed by the user for {ActionName}. A shortcut is encoded as an int where the high 16 bits represent all the modifiers used, and the 0-15 bits represent which key is used.

histogram.name: Ash.Smoothness.PercentDroppedFrames_1sWindow2{Stage}
histogram.summary:
Tracks the percent of dropped frames in a 1 second sliding window.
PercentDroppedFrames is measured by tracking the number of frames which were not displayed on screen out of the total number of frames expected to be produced and displayed. In other words, the lower this number is, the smoother experience.
The ".InSession" covers the time of 1 minute beyond into user sessions. The 1 minute timeline is picked based on "Ash.Login.TimeUntilGoodADF" histogram, where about 93-94% user sessions fall under the 1 minute bar.
The metric is reported {Stage}.

variant.name: .InSession
variant.summary: on every frame after 1 min into session

histogram.name: Ash.Smoothness.PercentDroppedFrames_1sWindow{Stage}
histogram.obsolete: This metric is reported on every dropped frame instead of every frame. It is deprecated in favor of Ash.Smoothness.PercentDroppedFrames_1sWindow2.
histogram.summary:
Tracks the percent of dropped frames in a 1 second sliding window.
PercentDroppedFrames is measured by tracking the number of frames which were not displayed on screen out of the total number of frames expected to be produced and displayed. In other words, the lower this number is, the smoother experience.
The metric is reported {Stage}.

variant.name: .DuringLogin
variant.summary: after cryptohome mount but before login animations finish

variant.name: .InSession2
variant.summary: after observing good ADF for 5 seconds

histogram.name: Ash.Snap.CloseTwoWindowsDuration
histogram.summary: The elapsed time between a first snapped window getting closed and a second snapped window getting closed. Starts recording when a snapped window is closed. Ends recording when a snapped window on the opposite side is closed, or if a snapped window on the opposite side is unsnapped, records the maximum value of 50 hours (18000 seconds).

histogram.name: Ash.Snap.MinimizeTwoWindowsDuration
histogram.summary: The elapsed time between a first snapped window getting minimized and a second snapped window getting minimized. Starts recording when a window changes state from snapped to minimized. Ends recording when a second window changes state from snapped to minimized, or if the first window is no longer snapped on the same side, records the maximum value of 50 hours (18000 seconds).

histogram.name: Ash.Snap.SnapTwoWindowsDuration
histogram.summary: The elapsed time between a first window getting snapped and a second window getting snapped on the other side. Starts recording when one window gets snapped. Ends recording when another window is snapped on the other side of the screen, or if the first window is no longer snapped on the same side, records the maximum value of 50 hours (18000 seconds).

histogram.name: Ash.SpeechRecognitionSessionLength.{Location}
histogram.summary: The length of the speech recognition session happening on {Location}. This histogram records the length at the end of the session.

histogram.name: Ash.SplitView.DeviceOrientation.{DeviceUIMode}
histogram.summary: Emitted at entry to split view mode and each time the orientation or the device mode changes to report whether the device is in clamshell mode or tablet mode and whether the orientation is landscape or portrait.

histogram.name: Ash.SplitView.EntryPoint.DeviceOrientation
histogram.summary: Emitted at the entry point of split view mode, to report the device orientation is in landscape mode (left and right) or portrait mode (top and bottom).

histogram.name: Ash.SplitView.EntryPoint.DeviceUIMode
histogram.summary: Emitted at the entry point of split view mode, to report the device is in clamshell mode or tablet mode.

histogram.name: Ash.SplitView.OrientationInSplitView
histogram.summary: Emitted when device orientation changes in split view, to report the device orientation is in landscape mode (left and right) or portrait mode (top and bottom).

histogram.name: Ash.SplitView.ResizeWindowCount.{DeviceUIMode}
histogram.summary: Emitted at the end of split view mode to report the number of resizing window operations in split view mode session for both clamshell and tablet mode.

histogram.name: Ash.SplitView.SwapWindowCount
histogram.summary: Emitted at the end of split view mode to report the number of swap window operations in split view mode session.

histogram.name: Ash.SplitView.SwapWindowSource
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever two windows in split view are swapped. The recorded enum indicates where the swap operation is triggered, which can either be from double tap or swap button on the snap group expanded menu.

histogram.name: Ash.SplitView.TimeInMultiDisplaySplitView
histogram.summary: The amount of time that the user spent in multi-display split view mode, meaning that split view is active on more than one display. The time is measured from when the number of displays in split view becomes more than one to when it drops back down to one.

histogram.name: Ash.SplitView.TimeInSplitView
histogram.summary: The amount of time that the user spent in split view mode. The time is measured from the moment a window is snapped to one side of the screen to when split view mode is ended.

histogram.name: Ash.SplitView.{EngagementTime}.{DeviceUIMode}
histogram.summary: Emitted at the end of split view mode or the point of switching between clamshell mode and tablet mode in split view, to report the engagement time of general split view and multi-display split view in both clamshell mode and tablet mode.

histogram.name: Ash.SplitViewOverviewSession.WindowLayoutCompleteOnSessionExit.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Recorded at the exit point of the split view overview session in {TabletOrClamshell}. Emits true if the window layout setup is complete, false otherwise.

histogram.name: Ash.SplitViewOverviewSession.{SnapSource}.ExitPoint.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Recorded at the exit point of the split view overview session in {TabletOrClamshell}. The recorded enum indicates the reason that triggers the split view overview session exit.

histogram.name: Ash.SplitViewResize.AnimationSmoothness.DividerAnimation
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of animation when releasing the split view divider, recorded when the animation completes. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second.

histogram.name: Ash.SplitViewResize.PresentationTime.MaxLatency{SplitViewResizeModes}
histogram.summary: Maximum latency of the presentation time while resizing one or two split view windows. {SplitViewResizeModes}

histogram.name: Ash.SplitViewResize.PresentationTime{SplitViewResizeModes}
histogram.summary: Presentation time while resizing one or two split view windows. {SplitViewResizeModes}

histogram.name: Ash.StateKeysPresent
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated Mar 2023 because of the b:273278497. The data logged under this histogram is meaningless. Check Ash.StateKeysPresent2 for new data.
histogram.summary: The presense of state keys on first device policy fetch response. It is expected for state keys to be present. The histogram is logged only in case of successful device policy fetch response. Warning: This histogram was expired from 2022-07-03 to 2022-07-05; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Ash.StateKeysPresent2
histogram.summary: The presense of state keys on first device policy fetch response. It is expected for state keys to be present. The histogram is logged only in case of successful device policy fetch response. This is replacing the old Ash.StateKeysPresent histogram because a bug made that data useless.

histogram.name: Ash.StatusArea.TrayBackgroundView.BounceIn
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of the bounce in animation of tray background view. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. Emitted when animation is completed (when the shelf pod/tray background view is completely bounced in and shown the tray).

histogram.name: Ash.StatusArea.TrayBackgroundView.FadeIn
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of the fade in animation of tray background view. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. Emitted when animation is completed (when the shelf pod/tray background view is completely faded in and shown the tray).

histogram.name: Ash.StatusArea.TrayBackgroundView.Hide
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of the fade in animation of tray background view. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. Emitted when animation is completed (when the shelf pod/tray background view is completely hidden in the tray).

histogram.name: Ash.StatusArea.TrayBackgroundView.{State}
histogram.summary: Logged when: Hidden: a TrayBackgroundView's preferred visibility is set to false. Shown: a TrayBackgroundView's preferred visibility is set to true. Pressed: Logged when a TrayBackgroundView is activated, either showing a bubble or handling a custom action. The metric is expired from 2023-01-19 to 2023-03-15, so it's possible some data is dropped during that time.

histogram.name: Ash.StatusArea.TrayItemView.Hide
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of the hide animation of tray item view. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. Emitted when animation is completed (when the tray item is completely hidden in the tray).

histogram.name: Ash.StatusArea.TrayItemView.Show
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of the show animation of tray item view. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. Emitted when animation is completed (when the tray item is completely shown in the tray).

histogram.name: Ash.StatusAreaShowBubble.PresentationTime
histogram.summary: Presentation time while opening QuickSettings and Notification Center through Status Area button. Emitted when QuickSettings and Notification Center are opened and shown.

histogram.name: Ash.Style.ColorPalette.KMeansAlgorithm
histogram.summary: Whether or not to use the kmeans algorithm to determine the user's color palette. This metric is recorded once per UMA upload.

histogram.name: Ash.SwipeDownDrag.Tab.PresentationTime.MaxLatency.TabletMode
histogram.summary: Maximum latency of the presentation timestamp while dragging a tab in tablet mode.

histogram.name: Ash.SwipeDownDrag.Tab.PresentationTime.TabletMode
histogram.summary: Presentation time while dragging a tab in tablet mode.

histogram.name: Ash.SwipeDownDrag.Window.PresentationTime.MaxLatency.TabletMode
histogram.summary: Maximum latency of the presentation timestamp while dragging maximized window in tablet mode.

histogram.name: Ash.SwipeDownDrag.Window.PresentationTime.TabletMode
histogram.summary: Presentation time while dragging maximized window in tablet mode.

histogram.name: Ash.SwipeHomeToOverviewGesture
histogram.summary: Boolean indicating whether a swipe from hotseat on home screen resulted in a transition to overview.

histogram.name: Ash.SystemMenu.PercentageOfWorkAreaHeightCoveredByMenu
histogram.summary: The height of the system menu divided by the height of the Ash desktop work area; a value over 100% indicates that a portion of the system menu is not visible to the user. Recorded each time the menu is opened.

histogram.name: Ash.SystemMenu.Rows
histogram.summary: The number of user-visible rows in the system menu's default view. Recorded each time the menu is opened.

histogram.name: Ash.TabDrag.PresentationTime
histogram.summary: Presentation time in ms when a tab is dragged. In clamshell mode, each time a tab is dragged within a display, the time it takes to present the new frame on screen is recorded. In tablet mode (with webui tab strip enable), dragging between displays is precluded, thus each time a tab is dragged, the time it takes to present the new frame to screen is recorded.

histogram.name: Ash.TabDrag.PresentationTime.MaxLatency
histogram.summary: Maximum presentation time recorded during a tab dragging session in both clamshell and tablet mode.

histogram.name: Ash.TabletMode.AnimationSmoothness.Enter
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of animations when entering tablet mode, recorded when the animation completes. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second.

histogram.name: Ash.TabletMode.AnimationSmoothness.Exit
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of animations when exiting tablet mode, recorded when the animation completes. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchMoveSteps
histogram.summary: The distance between touch-move events.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchStartAfterEnd
histogram.summary: The interval between the end of a touch-sequence and the start of the next touch-sequence.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchView.LidAngle
histogram.summary: Chrome OS only. The computed angle between the lid and the keyboard panel. These values are imprecise and may be tens of degrees off from reality. Reported once per hour that the system is awake, and not reported if the system doesn't have two accelerometers.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchView.TouchViewActive
histogram.summary: The length of time that TouchView is active, for each activation.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchView.TouchViewActivePercentage
histogram.summary: The proportion of time spent in TouchView during a session.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchView.TouchViewActiveTotal
histogram.summary: The total time that TouchView is active during a session.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchView.TouchViewInactive
histogram.summary: The length of time between TouchView activations.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchView.TouchViewInactiveTotal
histogram.summary: The total time that TouchView is not active during a session.

histogram.name: Ash.UnifiedSystemView.Button.Activated
histogram.summary: Recorded when any button in the old quick settings view is activated.

histogram.name: Ash.UnifiedSystemView.FeaturePod.{FeaturePodBehavior}
histogram.summary: Recorded when an action is done on any FeaturePod in the old quick settings view. {FeaturePodBehavior} can be a toggle to enable the feature, toggle to disable this feature, going to the feature's detailed page, or making the button visible.

variant.name: DiveIn
variant.summary: Go to the feature's detailed page

histogram.name: Ash.UnifiedSystemView.Slider.{SliderBehavior}
histogram.summary: Recorded when an action is done on any slider in the old quick settings view or in the slider bubble. {SliderBehavior} can be changing the value or toggling to enable the feature.

histogram.name: Ash.UnifiedSystemView.{DeviceMode}.FeaturePodCountOnOpen
histogram.summary: The number of feature pods (e.g. WiFi, Bluetooth, IME, Accessibility, etc.) in the old system tray quick settings when it is opened, including pods that overflow to other pages. This metric is logged by 2 different types of {DeviceMode}: "Clamshell" and "Tablet". This metric gets recorded for both the new quick settings view and the old unified system view, see "Ash.QuickSettings.{DeviceMode}.FeaturePodCountOnOpen" which is the metric for the new quick settings view.

histogram.name: Ash.UnlockAnimation.Smoothness
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of all animations applied during the unlock process. 100% represents the ideal smoothness for 60 frames per second. The metric was expired from 2022-04-18 to 2023-07-12 (revived in M117), it's possible some data was dropped during that time.

histogram.name: Ash.UserDataStatsRecorder.DataSize.TotalSize
histogram.summary: Records the size of the entire profile data directory. Collected upon launching ash chrome.

histogram.name: Ash.UserDataStatsRecorder.DataSize.{ItemName}
histogram.summary: Records the size of each file/dir directly under user data directory.

histogram.name: Ash.UserImage.URLLoaderDownloadSuccess
histogram.summary: Emitted when loading default user images from gstatic resources. Records whether an image download attempt was successful or not.

histogram.name: Ash.VideoConference.NumberOfRepeatedShows
histogram.summary: Record the number of times that the video conference tray repeatedly shows per 100ms. Emitted when the sequence of consecutive shows in the video conference tray has finished.

histogram.name: Ash.VideoConference.ReturnToApp.Click
histogram.summary: Records the app type of the media app that users want to return to when they click the return to app button in the video conference panel.

histogram.name: Ash.VideoConference.ReturnToAppButton.FadeOut.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of the fade out animation of the return to app button inside the video conference controls. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. Emitted when the fade out animation is completed.

histogram.name: Ash.VideoConference.ReturnToAppPanel.BoundsChange.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of the bounds change animation of the return to app panel inside the video conference controls. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. Emitted when the bounds change animation is completed.

histogram.name: Ash.VideoConference.{ViewName}.FadeIn.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of the fade in animation of the {ViewName} inside the video conference controls. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. Emitted when the fade in animation is completed.

histogram.name: Ash.VideoConferenceTray.BackgroundBlur.Click
histogram.summary: Records the background blur state that users want to switch to when they choose a different value for background blur effect in the tab slider of the video conference panel.

histogram.name: Ash.VideoConferenceTray.BackgroundBlur.InitialState
histogram.summary: Records the initial state of background blur when the Video Conference Panel is shown.

histogram.name: Ash.VideoConferenceTray.StopScreenShareButton.Click
histogram.summary: Recorded when the stop screen share button in video conference tray is clicked.

histogram.name: Ash.VideoConferenceTray.ToggleBubbleButton.Click
histogram.summary: Recorded when the toggle bubble button in video conference tray is clicked to open/close the bubble.

histogram.name: Ash.VideoConferenceTray.{Device}MuteButton.Click
histogram.summary: Recorded when the {Device} mute button in video conference tray is clicked. We will record if the user clicks the button to mute or to un-mute the {Device}.

histogram.name: Ash.VideoConferenceTray.{EffectName}.Click
histogram.summary: Recorded when the toggle button of {EffectName} in the video conference bubble is clicked. We will record if the user clicks the button to enable or disable the effect.

histogram.name: Ash.VideoConferenceTray.{EffectName}.Toggle.InitialState
histogram.summary: Records the initial state of {EffectName} when the Video Conference Panel is shown.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.Collection
histogram.summary: The wallpaper collection of the selected online wallpaper. Recorded each time the online wallpaper image is selected, but not when wallpaper is automatically refreshed.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.CustomLayout
histogram.summary: The custom wallpaper layout type. Recorded when the user sets a new custom wallpaper or changes the existing custom wallpaper's layout.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.GooglePhotos.Api.{Api}.RefreshCount
histogram.summary: Records the refresh count for the request of the Google Photos API which {Api} with a valid refresh token. The count increases each time a user scrolls down to the end of the page to fetch more photos or albums from the Google Photos API. Emitted only at the end of a session.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.GooglePhotos.Api.{Api}.ResponseTime.{Result}
histogram.summary: Records the response time for the {Result} request to the Google Photos API which {Api}. Emitted only on {Result} parsing of the API response at the moment parsing is completed.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.GooglePhotos.Api.{Api}.Result
histogram.summary: Records the result for the request to the Google Photos API which {Api}. Emitted for both failed and successful parsing of the API request at the moment parsing is completed.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.GooglePhotos.Api.{Api}.Result.Count
histogram.summary: Records the result count for the response of the Google Photos API which {Api}. Emitted only on successful parsing of the API response at the moment parsing is completed.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.GooglePhotos.Source
histogram.obsolete: Replaced 01/2023 by Ash.Wallpaper.GooglePhotos.Source2.
histogram.summary: Records the section of the Wallpaper App from which a Google Photos wallpaper was selected. Emitted regardless of the selection's success. b/262449270: Adds new enums to record when a user picks a photo from owned or shared albums with the Google Photos shared albums feature.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.GooglePhotos.Source2
histogram.summary: Records the section of the Wallpaper App from which a Google Photos wallpaper was selected. Emitted regardless of the selection's success.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.Image
histogram.summary: The selected online wallpaper. Recorded each time the online wallpaper image is selected, but not when wallpaper is automatically refreshed.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.IsSetToTimeOfDayAfterOobe
histogram.summary: Tracks whether the time of day wallpaper is set to be the default wallpaper successfully on supported devices. Recorded each time the user goes through OOBE flow and they did not have any synced wallpaper on any of their previous devices.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.Preview.Show
histogram.summary: Tracks the preview mode usage for wallpaper. Recorded each time the wallpaper image is previewed.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.Source2
histogram.summary: Recorded when a user attempts to set a wallpaper, either by the built-in Wallpaper App, or by a third party App. Note the wallpaper change triggered by Sync file system event doesn't count.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.Type
histogram.summary:
The wallpaper type. Recorded at user login.
This metric expired in April 2022 and was revived in August 2022. Data between these times is incomplete.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.{WallpaperType}.Result
histogram.obsolete: Replaced Aug 2023 by Ash.Wallpaper.{WallpaperType}.Result2.
histogram.summary: Tracks the result of user's attempt to set a wallpaper. Recorded when a user selects a wallpaper from the personalization hub. b/285387348: Add more variants and fix incorrect metric recording for online wallpapers.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.{WallpaperType}.Result2
histogram.summary: Tracks the result of user's attempt to set a wallpaper of type {WallpaperType}. Recorded when a user selects a {WallpaperType} wallpaper from the personalization hub.

histogram.name: Ash.Window.AnimationSmoothness.CrossFade
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of cross fade animation when setting window bounds. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. 50% represents when only 30 frames per second is achieved during the animations. 0% should not happen. This metric is recorded exactly once when SetBoundsDirectCrossFade is called, such as when window is maximized.

histogram.name: Ash.Window.AnimationSmoothness.CrossFade.DragMaximize
histogram.summary: When dragging a maximized window, the window will shrink to restore bounds. Dragging the window back to the top of the screen will expand the window. This histogram is fired only if the window is initially maximized. If we drag a normal window to maximized state, the animation smoothness will be recorded in the regular cross fade histogram above. This histogram will be recorded to measure the smoothenss of the expand animation. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. 50% represents when only 30 frames per second is achieved during the animations. 0% should not happen.

histogram.name: Ash.Window.AnimationSmoothness.CrossFade.DragUnmaximize
histogram.summary: When dragging a maximized window, the window will shrink to restore bounds. This histogram is fired everytime we drag a maximized window to normal state. This histogram will be recorded to measure the smoothness of the shrink animation. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. 50% represents when only 30 frames per second is achieved during the animations. 0% should not happen.

histogram.name: Ash.Window.AnimationSmoothness.Hide
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of hiding window animation. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. 50% represents when only 30 frames per second is achieved during the animations. 0% should not happen. This metric is recorded exactly once when AnimateHideWindowCommon is called, such as when window is closed.

histogram.name: Ash.Window.AnimationSmoothness.Minimize
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of minimizing window animation. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. 50% represents when only 30 frames per second is achieved during the animations. 0% should not happen. This metric is recorded exactly once when AnimateHideWindow_Minimize is called, such as when window is minimized.

histogram.name: Ash.Window.AnimationSmoothness.Snap
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of snapping window animation. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. 50% represents when only 30 frames per second is achieved during the animations. 0% should not happen. This metric is recorded exactly once when a window is snapped to the left or right in clamshell mode using the alt + [ or ] accelerator, but only if the size of the window's bounds change.

histogram.name: Ash.Window.AnimationSmoothness.Unminimize
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of unminimizing window animation. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. 50% represents when only 30 frames per second is achieved during the animations. 0% should not happen. This metric is recorded exactly once when AnimateShowWindow_Minimize is called, such as when window is unminimized.

histogram.name: Ash.Window.DragMaximized.NumberOfMisTriggers
histogram.summary: Emitted when a window state is being destroyed. Records number of mis-triggers of the drag to maximize behavior for a window during its lifetime.

histogram.name: Ash.Window.DragMaximized.Valid
